secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon posits that because God is the kind of God who delivers (Program 1), the graduates are called to a life of resistance (Program 2).

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon centers on God's 'Pouvoir' (Ability) which creates a 'Vouloir' (Willingness to die) in the human subject.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S1 (God is able) to ~S2 (Even if He doesn't) to S1 (He is still God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved in the Cross—God is God even in the fire.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the furnace is 'hasty, painful, and unpleasant execution'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon issues strong calls to action, the 'engine' is the unconditional nature of God's character ('God is God... for his own sake').

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: They refused to smoke the dope... they were healthier and smarter.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Our God whom we serve is able to deliver us.
Ultimately the story... is a story not of glory, but of the Cross.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The three Hebrews are initially presented as models of resistance, but this is eventually grounded in the 'Fourth Man' and God's sovereignty.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God preserves His name through the weakness of His servants.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Moves from the pressure of 'having to resist' to the peace of 'God is able'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical narrative to the contemporary 'Babylon' of the graduates is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God will deliver' and 'But if not'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God who... has chosen what is weak in the world to shame the strong.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon speaks of 'supernatural power' gripping the men, implying an endowment of Pouvoir.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'totalitarian effect' and 'idolatry' rather than just mistakes.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject of power (Pouvoir), preventing the call to resistance from becoming a new Law.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The list of 'You are going to be tempted' risks making the hearer the sole Subject of the struggle.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The hearer as the one 'walking in the fire' with the Fourth Man.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the Fourth Man is already in the furnace before the graduates arrive.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly link the 'discernment' to the work of the Holy Spirit.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is correctly identified as a cosmic/systemic power.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining theocentricity while addressing a specific human occasion (Baccalaureate).

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the repetition of the instruments; semiotics reveals this repetition as the 'Opponent's' attempt to dissolve the Subject's agency.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Babylonian names; semiotics explains why the 'Subject-switch' in the 'But if not' clause is the structural heart of the text.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Fourth Man' is the necessary Helper that allows the Subject (God) to reach the Receiver (The Three) in the zone of the Opponent (The Fire).

volledige_subject_lijst: You are going to be tempted
appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Moralistic Therapeutic Deism' trap by emphasizing the 'But If Not' clause, which decouples God's value from human benefit.
